Container.Name: MyMediaForAlexa
Container.Overview: A media server that allows you to stream audio files (e.g. music and audiobooks) that are stored on your unRAID server to Alexa enabled devices such as Amazon Echo or Amazon Dot using voice control.[p] More details and the full list of features can be found on the My Media For Alexa [a href=http://mymediaalexa.com]web site[/a]. [p] Additional detail on setting up My Media For Alexa on unRAID can be found [a href=https://github.com/itimpi/MyMediaForAlexa]here[/a][p] To administer the My Media For Alexa server use the WebUI.

Config.Name: Data folder
Config.Description: The location for config settings and indexing information

Config.Name: Media Library
Config.Description: The location of the media to be handled by My Media For Alexa

Config.Name: Alexa port
Config.Description: Port used to communicate with Alexa <p>MUST NOT BE CHANGED</p>

Config.Name: Admin port
Config.Description: Admin port used to manage My Media For Alexa <p>MUST NOT BE CHANGED</p>

Container.Description: A media server that allows you to stream audio files (e.g. music and audiobooks) that are stored on your unRAID server to Alexa enabled devices such as Amazon Echo or Amazon Dot using voice control. More details and the full list of features can be found on the My Media For Alexa web site. Additional detail on setting up My Media For Alexa on unRAID can be found here To administer the My Media For Alexa server use the WebUI.
